rdf:Description.dcterms:title: Parliamentary committees and policy formulation : a case study of the role of the House of Commons Standing Committee on Finance, Trade and Economic Affairs in the process of tax reform in Canada.
rdf:Description.dc:abstract: The process of tax reform in Canada between 1962 and 1971 was characterized by unprecedented public discussion before the introduction of legislative proposals by the Minister of Finance. The House of Commons Standing Committee on Finance, Trade and Economic Affairs served to channel much of the latter part of the debate and then produced recommendations, many of which were accepted by the Government. The purpose of this thesis is to examine the work of the Finance Committee in its study of tax reform in order to reach some conclusions as to the role of Standing Committees of the House of Commons in policy formulation. The thesis also attempts to examine the function of White Papers in promoting public participation in policy-making.
rdf:Description.dc:subject: Canada. Parliament. House of Commons. Standing Committee on Finance, Trade and Economic Affairs.
Taxation -- Canada.

rdf:Description.dcterms:title: Viscoelastic analysis of fiberglass reinforced composites
rdf:Description.dc:contributor: Department of Civil Engineering and Applied Mechanics
rdf:Description.dc:abstract: The mechanical properties of cloth, glass fiber polyester composite at different temperatures are determined. The viscoe1astic properties of this material are characterized by using relaxation tests. The theoretical relationships are used in appropriate computer programs. This includes correction of the relaxation curves for the finite rise time of strain. The experimental effort covers studies on specimens tested at different temperatures (-40 to 400~) and strain levels (0.1 to 1.2 percent). The linear viscoelastic behavior is verified for each testing temperature. The relaxation data are plotted on double logarithmic paper, and the viscoelastic properties at very short and long time are found by shifting the data into a master curve. The material is found to be linear viscoelastic and the time temperature superposition principle is also found to be valid over the temperature range investigated [...]
rdf:Description.dc:subject: Fibrous composites.
Viscoelasticity.

rdf:Description.dcterms:title: Le chercheur de trésors : tentative d'analyse structurale
rdf:Description.dc:contributor: Département de langue et littérature françaises
rdf:Description.dc:abstract: Le Chercheur de tresors ou L'Infiuence d'un livre, qu'historiquement on a defini comme le premier roman canadienfran~ais, a toujours ete meconnu par la critique dtici. Nous tenterons par une analyse fonctionnelle, de mettre en relief les traits dominants de la structure du recit, autant comme "histoire" que comme "discours" (selon les termes empruntes a Tzvetan Todorov) [...]
rdf:Description.dc:subject: Gasepé, Philippe Aubert de, 1786-1871. Chercheur de trésors.
Litterature
XIXe siecle
French

rdf:Description.dcterms:title: A Study of political attitudes in Pontiac County
rdf:Description.dc:abstract: This thesis reports the results of a project initiated in December, 1967, with the aim of studying the relationship between such traditional bases of cleavage as language and religion, on the one hand, and system affect, on the other. Toward that end a sample survey was conducted in P~ntiac, a Quebec county particularly well suited to the testing of hypotheses concerning the attitudes of French-speaking Catholics, English-speaking Protestants, and English-speaking Catholics toward the federal and Quebec provincial systems.
rdf:Description.dc:subject: Pontiac (Québec : County) -- Politics and government.
Political attitudes
Federalism

rdf:Description.dcterms:title: Prolonged Changes in the Brain
rdf:Description.dc:abstract: Prolonged changes in mUlti-unit activity in the somatosensory projection system evoked by somatic input were studied in anesthetized cats. Prolonged changes in tonic baseline activity were observed in all sampled areas. Changes also occurred in bursting--slow, rhythmic increases in activity above tonic levels seen at higher levels of the somatosensory system. Baseline and bursting changes were elicited independently or in combination with one another in a single response. Bursting changes were occasionally observed to reverse direction during the course of the experiment. The occurrence or direction of prolonged responses were usually related to parameters of prestimulus activity.
rdf:Description.dc:subject: Psychology
Somatic Stimulation
Brain

rdf:Description.dcterms:title: Le Juif dans Le Roman Canadien-Francais Du XXe Siecle
rdf:Description.dc:abstract: Les Juifs et les Canadiens français ont longtemps vécu cloisonnes dans leurs milieux au sein même du Québec. Depuis une décennie, on note un rapprochement entre les deux groupes. Bien avant l'établissement de relations étroites, cependant, le romancier québécois s'intéressait déjà au Juif, mais l'image qu'il rendait de ce dernier reflétait les préjuges de son proprem.1lieu. Le personnage mythique que l'on a le plus associe au Ju1f est celui du commerçant ruse et âpre au gain; aussi le retrouve-t-on souvent dans le roman québécois. La figure du Juif représente, par contre, des caractéristiques complexes; elle symbolise, par exemple, la souffrance humaine et les romanciers s'identifient à l'angoisse qu'éprouvent leurs personnages. L'idéalisation du Juif représente donc un autre aspect de sa complexité et les écrivains découvrent alors un charme particulier dans l'exotisme qu'évoque pour eux la Juive.
rdf:Description.dc:subject: Jews -- Québec (Province).
French-Canadian fiction -- 20th century -- History and criticism.
Jews in literature.

rdf:Description.dcterms:title: NATO burden sharing : a case study in alliance cohesion
rdf:Description.dc:abstract: Ce mémoire de recherche essaie de combiner une analyse historique de trois questions au sujet e la cohésion des pactes militaires avec une étude empirique d'une de ces questions. Les trois questions sont: le contrôle des armes, la modernisation et le partage des conts. Le mémoire est constitué de trois parties principales. Dans la première partie, les théories dites de coopération collective et du clubs sont présentées afin de discuter des questions du bien public, des groupes privilégies, des intérêts de sécurité, et du partage des conts. Dans la deuxième partie, on fait un survol de la littérature concernant les trois questions du contrôle des armes, de la modernisation et du partage des conts. On y'trauve aussi une revue des études empiriques concernant le partage des conts dans l'organisation du traite de l'Atlantique du Nord (l'OTAN). Dans la partie analytique du mémoire, des hypothèses sont postulées et testées à l'aide de statistiques. Dans la conclusion, certaines implications des résultats sont examinées et des pistes pour des recherches futures sont suggérées.

This research paper seeks to combine historical analysis of three issues related to alliance cohesion with an empirical analysis of alliance cohesion in one of those areas. The three issues are arms control, modernization and burden sharing. There are three maj or sections of the paper. In the first, collective action theory and club theory are put forward to address the issues of public goods , privileged groups, defense goods, and burden sharing. In the second section, an overview of the literature is presented on the issues of arms control, modernization and burden sharing. Also presented is a review of the empirical literature on NATO burden sharing. In the analytical portion of the paper, hypotheses are postulated and subjected to statistical testing. Implications of the results and directions for further research are explored in the conclusion.
rdf:Description.dc:subject: North Atlantic Treaty Organization -- Military policy.
Security, International.

rdf:Description.dcterms:title: La jeunesse dorée : parlementarisme et dictature de la rue en l’an III
rdf:Description.dc:abstract: La Jeunesse Dorée représente espèce d’avant-garde politisée de la bourgesie parisienne de l'an III. Issue du monde des spectacles, des 1ettres, de la banque .et des administrations publique, elle servit d'outil de gouvernement aux thermidoriens autant qu'elle aiguillonna ceux-ci vers la réaction. Par leur débauche et leur luxe effronté qui insultaient la misère populaire, les jeunes gens catalysèrent le dynamisme insurrectionnel des masses qui devait éclater en prairial.
rdf:Description.dc:subject: France -- History -- Revolution, 1789-1799.
France -- Politics and government -- 1789-

rdf:Description.dcterms:title: The effect of planned social interaction on institutionalized infants.
rdf:Description.dc:abstract: The purpose of this research was to determine what changes could be effected in institutionalized infants by daily 20-minute social interactions. In Study I, the independent variable was the responsiveness of the interaction to the infant's initiative (a contingency-non contingency dimension). In Study 11, the independent variable was the number of interactors (single versus multiple interactors). Both studies showed that some changes could be brought about in locomotor development, eye-hand coordination, and certain problem solving abilities. The second study also showed that this stimulation was more effective when performed by one person as opposed to many persons. Two groups of crèche infants, one with an average age of 27.25 weeks, the other with an average age of 33.17 weeks, were also compared, and an attempt was made to delineate the environmental variables underlying the functioning of each group as well as the differences between them.
rdf:Description.dc:subject: Social interaction.
Infants.
Child development.

rdf:Description.dcterms:title: Changes in the intra-urban land value surface : the impact of transportation, land use and socio-economic factors in central Montreal
rdf:Description.dc:abstract: The most significant findings of this research have to do with the impact of changes in the transportation system on the intra-urban land value surface. On an aggregated level, new highway facilities appear to be less important as a determinant of land values than major changes in the public (and, particularly, rapid) transit system. Other aspects of this empirical investigation suggest that land use and land values are related by a two-way causal link. Finally, it is abundantly clear that there is a great deal of sectoral variation with regard to the-variables which dominate in the prediction of urban land values. Factors related to the urban social system tend to be more important on a sectoral level in explaining the land value surface, whereas accessibility is the predominant consideration on the larger scale of the whole study area.

Ce projet de recherche dégage les éléments suivants en ce qui a trait à l'impact des transports sur les valeurs des terres en milieu urbain. Sur l'échelle de toute la région délimitée, la construction de nouvelles routes et autoroutes a mains d'influence sur des valeurs des terres urbaines que des innovations de nouveaux systèmes de transports en commun (exemple: le Metro). En plus, les valeurs des terres ont un rapport avec l'utilisation du sol urbain qui prend la forme d'un lien causal à deux sens. Finalement, i1 se dégage ega1ement qu’il y a beaucoup de variation spatiale entre 1es différent secteurs de la vil1e en ce qui concerne 1es variables prédominantes dans l'explication de la surface théorique des valeurs des terres.
rdf:Description.dc:subject: Urban transportation -- Québec (Province) -- Montréal Metropolitan Area -- Mathematical models.
Land use -- Québec (Province) -- Montréal Metropolitan Area -- Mathematical models.
Real property -- Valuation -- Québec (Province) -- Montreal metropolitan Area -- Mathematical models.

rdf:Description.dcterms:title: Mathematics teaching and mathematics achievement in Hong Kong : an extension of the International Project for the evaluation of Educational Achievement.
rdf:Description.dc:abstract: Mathematics teaching and mathematics achievement were studied in Hong Kong, at a time when the world wide movement for the modernization of mathematics education had begun to affect that city. The International Project for the Evaluation of Educational Achievement (lEA) had listed a number of environmental variables believed to be related to educational achievement, and studied the effect of these upon achievement in mathematics in twelve countries. Three parallel achievement tests of one and a half hour duration were constructed, using all the items of the lEA test for thirteen year old children, and applied to a sample of schools in Hong Kong. The interrelationships of the societal factors in this study were compared with those of the twelve nations of the lEA study.
rdf:Description.dc:subject: Mathematical ability.
Mathematics -- Study and teaching (Secondary) -- China -- Hong Kong.

rdf:Description.dcterms:title: The schlemihl as hero in Yiddish and American fiction
rdf:Description.dc:abstract: The schlemihl is a Yiddish subspecies of the universal fool figure. Victim of endless misfortune, the schlemihl of Yiddish folk humor converts his losses to verbal advantage and his defeats into psychological victories. Yiddish storytellers, including Rabbi Nachman of Bratzlav, Mendele Mocher Sforim, Sholom Aleichem, and Isaac Bashevis Singer, created versions of the schlemihl-hero to explore the irony of a faith which could coexist with doubt. Irony was both a national and literary means of retaining trust in God and goodness while encountering barbaric forms of persecution. Though originally alies to America, Yiddish humor penetrated the general culture, particularly after World War II. American Jewish writers, like Saul Bellow and Bernard Malamud, used the schlemihl to explore the paradox of failure as success within a secular humanist culture. The schlemihl-stance coincided with the national mood for over a decade: it may not survive the sixties.
rdf:Description.dc:subject: American literature -- Jewish authors -- History and criticism.
Fools and jesters in literature.
Yiddish literature -- History and criticism.

rdf:Description.dcterms:title: Conformity to sex role among adolescents : social background and educational consequences.
rdf:Description.dc:abstract: A study of High School adolescents from the Province of Quebec was conducted to determine their conformity to sex role expectations as defined by Talcott Parsons. Evidence of conflicting sex role patterns was found when investigations were based on role model or values for education and work. Both distributions indicated much convergence of sex roles among both boys and girls. The effect of age, cultural background, socio-economic status and intelligence on the degree of conformity was examined. Cultural background proved the most influential factor while socio-economic status and intelligence differed considerably by sex. The consequences of sex role orientation on educational choices, aspirations and advisors were investigated. The higher social status of certain subject areas seemed more influential on educational choices than sex role expectations. Sex role divergents tended towards high educational aspirations -few rejected education. Sex role orientation proved to have no influence on education advisors.
rdf:Description.dc:subject: Sex differences (Psychology)

rdf:Description.dcterms:title: An exploratory study concerning the prerequisites for learning in literature.
rdf:Description.dc:abstract: This study, based on the hierarchial model of R. M. Gagne (1965) is designed to investigate some of the prerequisites for learning in literature. An instrument has been constructed in two parte, which seeks to determine whether successful performance in a complex learning task in literature is dependent on the presence in the repertoire of the learner of the relevant prerequisite structures. Part One of the instrument is designed to measure whether a certain principle is present in the repertoire of the learner, and Part Two is designed to measure whether the learner can use this principle in a problem solving task. Analysis of the data suggests that Gagne1s model which uses mathematics and physics as content or experimental investigation is applicable, as he suggests, in other content areas ae well. Our data suggests that at least or certain aspects of the literary response learning is based on the acquisition by the learner of cognitive structures which form a hierarchy within this content area.
rdf:Description.dc:subject: Literature -- Study and teaching.

rdf:Description.dcterms:title: Metabolism of free and conjugated estrogens by renal preparations in vitro
rdf:Description.dc:abstract: Renal tissue homogenates of different species: rat, hen, rabbit and dog were used to study the metabolism of 3H-Estrone (El), Estradiol 17S (Ez); Estrone Sulfate (EIS) and Estradiol 17S glucuronide (EZG) separately. The metabolites were separated by various extraction procedures and the conjugates investigated by chromatography on DEAE-sephadex. The main steroid found following incubation of El or Ez in all species was El. This agrees with most in vitro studies except where gonadal tissue is concerned. More polar metabolites were virtually absent and there was no evidence of sulfurylation having occurred. Some glucuronide formation was apparent. Incubation of EIS showed a wide range of sulfatase activities, extremely high in the rat and very low in the dog. The hen, followed by the rabbit showed intermediate values. Kidney preparations from rabbit and dog appeared capable of metabolizing EIS without prior hydrolysis. Little evidence was obtained for the presence of significant S-glucuronidase activity in these tissues. On occasion it appeared that EzG could be converted to conjugated metabolites probably the N-acetyl glucosamine derivative.
rdf:Description.dc:subject: Kidney

rdf:Description.dcterms:title: Les caractéristiques sociales et psychologiques des militants d’un parti indépendantiste québécois : essai d’analyse en psychosociologie politique
rdf:Description.dc:abstract: The basis of the present study is a. research conducted by the author on the social and psychological characteristics of separatists in Quebec. Only a small part of the material collected is reported. After a Series of theoretical propositions derived from the behavioristic tradition, the author illustrates the combined influence of social and psychological factors on political involvement with data on ethnic contacts and social mobility experienced by separatists. Is was found, among other things, that the stronger the contacts with 1I',nglish-s~aking Canadians either at home or at work, the higher the involvement manifested by the separatist in the movement, but the less non-separatists tend to join the movement. At work, inside the organization, the proportion of English-speaking individuals in the upper levels and the ethnic affiliation of work mates affect the political involvement of the separatist. [...]
rdf:Description.dc:subject: Political psychology.
Québec (Province) -- History -- Autonomy and independence movements.

rdf:Description.dcterms:title: Marshall McLuhan, a study in the determinist fetishism of technology
rdf:Description.dc:abstract: If McLuhan’s attempts at synthesis focus the urgent need for a communications imagination , their obscurantism functions as a vaccination against truth. In prophesying retribalization, he fabricates an idealist stasis susceptible to religious exegesis and preaches a neo-Thomist morality of submission and passive acceptance. Circumscribed by his biochemical theory of extension and his theory of meaning ('the medium is the message/massage/mass age), their radical anthropomorphism and formal subjectivism constituting the main features of his idealist ontology and epistemology, the keystone of McLuhan’s theory is the determinist fetishism of technology. Media are seen as the cause and ultimate effect of everything; human praxis and development disappear in an Eleatic pseudo-history generated by a pseudo-dialectic. McLuhan IS voluntarist reductionism, liquidating all discrepant particulars, is a double fetishism of content and form which impoverishes the rich, ever-totalizing totality of human existence, and serves to legitimate and reinforce stable forms of domination.
rdf:Description.dc:subject: McLuhan, Marshall, 1911-1980.

rdf:Description.dcterms:title: Mistassini hunters of the boreal forest : ecosystem dynamics and multiple subsistence patterns
rdf:Description.dc:abstract: This thesis applies an ecosystem analysis in a hunting and gathering culture for the first time, namely the pre-contact Mistassini Indians of the sub-arctic boreal forest of Quebec. It shows how ecosystem analysis makes possible the resolution of long standing debates unresolved by previous Stewardian cultural ecological analyses; in particular, thedebates over the aboriginality of the family hunting territory system and over the primary aboriginal subsistence base. On the basis of an extensive review of current biological knowledge on the boreal forest ecosystem an attempt is made to reconstruct the pre-contact strategy of adaptation, with particular stress on tfeast or famine' as a mechanism for maintaining human population density equilibrium. In addition, a hypothesis is proposed as a possible guide for further research on the ecosystems of hunters and gatherers: that in hunting and gathering societies the socio-cultural subsystem will respond to the variability, both spatial and temporal, of the environmental subsystem.
rdf:Description.dc:subject: Mistassin Indians.
Indians of North America -- Hunting.

rdf:Description.dcterms:title: Intergovernmental functions in respect to regional planning : with special reference to the region of Montreal.
rdf:Description.dc:contributor: Department of Economics and Political Science
rdf:Description.dc:abstract: The development of the metropolitan region as the focal point of many of the difficult problems which our federal system faces in adjusting to growing urbanization is described. The legislative vacuum left in the wake of urban sprawl cannot be filled by either the federal or provincial .governments, nor by the local governmental units since they are incapable of providing even the essential services for their citizens. The co-operation of all three levels of government is not considered an ultimate solution for the administrative problems of the city-centered region. A regional administrative body should be the legislative and executive answer to the metropolitan region where decisions are made and successively implemented. In the region of Montreal such an authority seems to be in the offing.
rdf:Description.dc:subject: Regional planning.
Regional planning -- Québec (Province) -- Montréal.
City planning -- Québec (Province) -- Montréal.

rdf:Description.dcterms:title: The impact of the automotive trade agreement between Canada and the United States
rdf:Description.dc:contributor: Department of Economics and Political Science
rdf:Description.dc:abstract: This thesis is a study of the developments which have occurred in the Canadian automotive industry as a result of the implementation of the Automotive Trade Agreement of 1965.The thesis first establishes the historical growth patterns of the Canadian automotive industry, paying particular attention to the effects of Canada's protective commercial policy and to the various schemes, e.g., export remission plans that were devised to facilitate its growth. The Automotive Trade Agreement is evaluated with respect to production of automotive equipment, vehicles and parts; changes in employment levels; wages (and productivity) and the pricing policies of the automotive companies.The principal economic gain achieved by the Canadian automotive industry is shown to lie in the rationalization of production facilities which has worked to narrow prices of similar type vehicles in Canada and the United States and to increase the volume of Canadian exports.
rdf:Description.dc:subject: Canada. Treaties, etc. United States, (1965 Jan. 16)
Automobile industry and trade -- United States.
Duty-free importation of automobiles -- Canada.
Automobile industry and trade -- Canada.
Duty-free importation of automobiles -- United States.

rdf:Description.dcterms:title: Trademark protection: an economic evaluation.
rdf:Description.dc:contributor: Department of Economics and Political Science
rdf:Description.dc:abstract: This paper seeks to determine the economic significance of trademark protection. The analysis covers the implications of the trademark law to consumer information, advertising and product differentiation, competitive behaviour and industry structure in the producing and the distributive trades. The author argues that trademark protection is partly responsible for strong barriers to entry of new firms into an industry. Not only does it encourage advertising and other forms of differentiation, it also serves to enforce restrictive arrangements such as exclusive distributorship, market sharing, tying, and resale price maintenance. It is also argued that through the above arrangements, trademark protection influences the structure of the distributive trades, hence their relative bargaining strength vis-a-vis the producers. The study shows further that although a trademark serves as a storehouse of information regarding a product's properties, the proliferation of trademarks may serve to confuse rather than inform the consumers. Finally, no reason has been found for associating “real" (as opposed to "fancied") differentiation with trademark protection.
rdf:Description.dc:subject: Trademarks -- Canada.
Commercial law -- Canada.

rdf:Description.dcterms:title: Chaucer’s Man of law and Clerk as rhetoricians : narrative and dramatic levels of decorum
rdf:Description.dc:abstract: The Man of Law's Tale and the Clerk' s ~prove Chaucer's functional use of rhetoric for purposes of decorum. Stylistically and psychologically# the prologues and tales fit the characters and intentions of the tellers. In contrast with the Man of Law and the Wife of Bath# the Clerk emerges as a scholar-rhetorician who follows Saint Augustine's precept to make learning and language subserve caritas and "essential truth." Chapter One surveys critical opinion on Chaucer's rhetoric and establishes criteria of decorum and juxtaposition. The second chapter examines the Man of Law's character from his description and performance. The third and fourth chapters analyze Trivet's, Gower's# and Chaucer's treatment of the Constance story and Chaucer's rhetorical infusions for purposes of characterization. Chapters five and six discuss the Clerk's training# character# and allegorical technique. The seventh chapter assesses the Clerk's rhetorical performance and sums up Chaucer's hitherto unrecognized achievement in decorum.
rdf:Description.dc:subject: Rhetoric, Medieval, in literature.
Chaucer, Geoffrey, d. 1400 -- Criticism and interpretation.

rdf:Description.dcterms:title: Confederate operations in Canada during the Civil War
rdf:Description.dc:abstract: This thesis investigates an 1864 Confederate campaign which originated in the neutral territory of the British provinces. Organizing the operations were Jacob Thompson of Mississippi and Clement C. Clay Jr. of Alabama, two prominent Confederates whose opposing attitudes towards war gave the Canadian campaign its complexity. The Confederate efforts were made possible by the vast discontent in the United states ., w~tt\, the war. Employing this discontent Thompson organized Confederate soldiers who had escaped from Northern prisons and, forming a coalition with anti-war anti-Lincoln forces in the United states, he attempted to disrupt the Northern war effort. Clay, on the other hand, disapproved of this policy of escalating the war. Clay was tired of bloodshed and his energy was directed primarily toward peace negotiations. Although both men failed to achieve their major objectives, the campaign exemplifies the desperate yet strategic maneuvers of the Confederacy during the last year of its struggle.
rdf:Description.dc:subject: United States -- History -- Civil War, 1861-1865.
Canada -- History -- 1841-1867.

rdf:Description.dcterms:title: Some Roman literary opinions on Judaism and Jews
rdf:Description.dc:abstract: The purpose of this paper is twofold: (1) to trace references to Judaism in Latin literature: (2) to analyze and evaluate the most pertinent texts. The method of interpretation is based on a detailed analysis of the text, considering political and social background only to a limited extent. The introduction outlines the problem and methods of the study, and gives a summary of the period's literary sources. Chapter one, based on an analysis of the speech Pro Flacco" 66-69, examines Cicero's attitude to Judaism. Chapter two is an analysis of Tacitus' Historiae, 5, 1-13. Its different sections examine the characteristics of the ethnographical excursus, the influence of conventional historiographical themes, and, finally, the discussion concentrates on particular points in Tacitus' presentation of the Jewish character. The conclusion compares the attitudes towards Jews in Cicero and Tacitus. Cicero appears as an advocate, who uses his derogatory remarks as a rhetorical device to invalidate Jewish witnesses. Tacitus' attitude is found to be biased, reflecting personal and general anti-Jewish prejudice. The appendix discusses various opinions on Judaism in the Hellenistic world, pointing out a marked change of attitude between early and later Hellenistic writers.
rdf:Description.dc:subject: Jews -- Rome.
Judaism in literature.
Jews in literature.
Tacitus, Cornelius. Historiae.
Cicero, Marcus Tullius. Pro Flacco.

rdf:Description.dcterms:title: The purchase of Alaska : Backgrounds and reactions
rdf:Description.dc:abstract: Vitus Bering discovered Alaska under the sponsorship of Peter the Great and Catherine I. The Russian American Company emerged as the principal trading company. Military considerations, financial pressure and friendship with the United States were among the factors that occasioned the offer. America accepted because of the cordial relations, desire for expansion and appreciation of the intrinsic value of Alaska. Reactions to the sale in the United States, Russia and Russian America, Canada, Great Britain and other European countries are discussed in this study.
rdf:Description.dc:subject: Alaska -- History -- To 1867.
